title: Function Concepts-Graphical and Analytical: Exponential, Part C

content.question: Part C (i) ​​​​Determine if <math alttext="f"> <mi>f</mi> </math> has an inverse function. (ii) Give a reason for your answer based on the definition of a function and the graph of <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>.

frqParts.text: Part C (i) ​​​​Determine if <math alttext="f"> <mi>f</mi> </math> has an inverse function. (ii) Give a reason for your answer based on the definition of a function and the graph of <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
